column4: hi all I uninstalled many games like torcs, flightgear and others, to free space on my disk
but :
http://dpaste.com/151564/
apt-get remove dont remove /usr/share/games data ????????
can I safely rm -rf /usr/share/games torcs and others ?
isnt this a apt bug ?
Remove the data packages etc. either through synaptic, or apt-get autoremove
remove with apt-get will only remove the named packages, but not "torcs-data" for example.
but "apt-get autoremove" should do that
try checking with "dpkg -S /usr/share/games/torcs" to see which package those files belong to.
did you only install the "torcs" package when you installed it, normally "torcs-data" is pulled along, but marked as auto-installed and hence can be autoremoved when "torcs" is removed.
if you installed those packages specifically they wont be able to autoremove.
many thanks for the dpkg -S command, seems to be the only working tool to find and kick game dependencies filling my disk

if you did not specifically install the fgfs-base package it *should* be automatically removable via autoremove, hmm... Also I know that aptitude tends to autoremove things automatically where apt-get doesn't, might be worth using instead in future..
